“Excuse me?” Said a breathy voice. Forest turned to see a girl about her age with long curly blonde hair and pale blue eyes. “I need some help.”
“I’m sorry I’m in a hurry. I need to get the Pokémon Center.”
“Why?” She asked.
“So I can heal my Pokémon.”
“Oh…” she said looking very thoughtful, “Uh, wait a minute,” She said as Forest began to walk away, Forest paused and turned back as the stranger spoke, “You’re in a hurry… because you need to go to the Pokémon Center…to heal you’re Pokémon…and that’s why you can’t help me, right?” she asked.
“Yes that’s right,” Forest nodded.
“So if you could heal you’re Pokémon right now…You could help me right?”
“I guess…” Forest said slowly.
“Well then, I’ll heal your Pokémon and then you can help me, okay?”
“Uh…”
1331211122112.title: Go to the Contest!

15.title: List of Important Characters

info.brief_description: Come see the new tropical region and catch all new PokÃ©mon, battle gyms, and get ribbons.
info.description:
Hello, and welcome. My name is Professor Hickory, and let me be the first to welcome you to the wonderful world of Pokemon! In this world, there live people and Pokemon, and we maintain a special balance together. For years, Pokemon and humans have lived alongside each other in peace and harmony. Some people use Pokemon as pets and submit them into special contests in hopes of becoming a top coordinator. For others, it's the thrill of being a trainer that drives them to face the Pokemon League. As for myself, I study the unique way in which this island region, the Curina Region, affects this said balance between humans and Pokemon. Strange things are play here, and I'm counting on you to help me. Your very own Pokemon adventure is about to unfold! Go on, get started!

BACKGROUND:
The Curina Region is a tropical island region located south of the Hoenn Region. It has a total of 10 cities, and has access to the Sevii Islands. The Cities include:

Ugaria Town: A calm and peaceful place where you begin your journey. It's located near the beach, and is where you live, as well as home to Professor Hickory's lab. There is a beach port here where you can travel to the Sevii Islands.

Sunshine City: Located near Ugaria Town, Sunshine City is a bustling urban area, home to the contest hall and gym leader Catherine, one of the most powerful ghost type trainers in the region. There is also a park here.

Fort Kinglapan: This city is a major military facility, home to the fighting type gym leader Markus. There is also a Beginner's Trainer Tower here where trainers may raise their Pokemon, levels 5-20 accepted.

Sotetsu Town: This rural town is home to farmers. It has a Pokemon school and a small field perfect for catching Pokemon at. The gym leader here is Nathaniel, a grass type trainer.

Ogonsho City: This large city contains a museum, covering the history of the Pokemon world and such. There is a Team Nuclear base located here, as well as a department store and a contest hall. There is a road that leads to Mount Duston, though it is only accessible to those who are strong enough to enter. Legend has it that the Sister Pokemon, Goldie and Silva, live here.

Shirogan City: This small city is home to gym the steel type gym leader Stephany, as well as the move deleter. It has a large forest that is great for finding and planting berries.

Scarlett City: This ominous city is the heartland of the eerie story surrounding the Curina Region. Legend has it that one of the most powerful trainers nearly caught the God Pokemon, Arceus, here before being cursed by the Angel Pokemon, Lafany, to live the rest of their life as a half Pokemon. Professor Hickory visits here often for research. The psychic type gym leader Dalin is here as well.

Yaju Town: This populous town is home to the Safari Zone, located near the ocean and Sanglo Cave. The dark type gym leader Merissa is here. There is also a contest hall here, as well as a global terminal used for trading with the other regions.

Vandlet City: This city is home to the people and Pokemon cemetery. Professor Hickory often visits here for research as well, and there is also a Team Nuclear building. The flying type gym leader Yolando is here. There is a path that leads to Sanglo Cave here.

Sanbert City: This city is actually more or less a village. There is a Daycare here, though rarely are there any people here. Pokemon do wander the streets, however, though catching Pokemon that are not in caves, water, or tall grass is extremely prohibited here and will result in a visit from Officer Joy. The ground type gym leader Nathan is here.
